page.title: 11CHURCHES IN BURSCOUGH
page.content: Burscough has one Church of England church and one Methodist chapel. The C. E. Church is dedicated to St John the Babtist and is sited at the north end of the village. It has a church hall and has two associated schools St Johns C E and Lordsgate Township. The present building was erected in 1832 as a memorial church following the Battle of Waterloo in 1815. There are many activities and groups associated with the Church including:Cubs,Scouts,Brownies and Guides.Sunday School,Womens Fellowship and Bible Classes. Burscough Methodist is a small church or chapel almost the same age as St Johns. It has a Day School which also uses the Church Hall. Its organisations are:Sunday School,Womens Groups,Guides, Cubs,Scouts,Brownies and Youth Fellow- ship meet in the Hall on various nights
